title: Three Particles

children.value:
Three identical particles $\vari{A}$ , $\vari{B}$ , and $\vari{C}$ are moving in a plane and, at time $\vari{t}$ , their position vectors, $\vari{\vtr {a}}$ , $\vari{\vtr {b}}$ , $\vari{\vtr {c}}$ , with respect to an origin $\vari{O}$ are:

$\displaystyle \vtr {a} $ $\displaystyle = $ $\displaystyle (2t +1)\vtr {i} + (2t+ 3)\vtr {j} $ $\displaystyle \vtr {b} $ $\displaystyle = $ $\displaystyle (10 - t)\vtr {i} + (12 - t)\vtr {j} $ $\displaystyle \vtr {c} $ $\displaystyle = $ $\displaystyle (t^{3} - 15t + 4)\vtr {i} + (-3t^{2} + 2t + 1)\vtr {j} $

Find the magnitude of the velocity of particle 
$\vari{C}$
 relative to particle 
$\vari{A}$
 when 
$\valuedef{t}{2}{}$
.

answer.value:
The vector makes an angle of 
$\vari{\arctan \left(\frac{5}{12}\right)}$
 to the negative 
$\vari{x}$
-axis, which is 
$157.4^{\circ }$
 clockwise or equivalently 
$202.6^{\circ }$
 anticlockwise.

children.value:
Find the angle which this relative velocity makes with 
$\vari{\vtr {i}}$
 at this time.

Verify that particles 
$\vari{A}$
 and 
$\vari{B}$
 are both moving along the straight line with equation 
$\valuedef{y}{x + 2}{}$
.

answer.value:
$\displaystyle \vtr {v}_{A_{f}} $ $\displaystyle = - \vtr {i} - \vtr {j} $ $\displaystyle \vtr {v}_{B_{f}} $ $\displaystyle = 2\vtr {i} + 2\vtr {j} $

which is simply a swapping over of velocities, as expected in an elastic collision with identical particles.
